an5.24:4.1: “Mendicants, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an5.24:4.2: When there is no right stillness, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an5.24:4.3: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an5.24:4.4: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.24:4.5: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an5.24:4.6: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an5.24:4.7: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an5.24:4.8: When there is no right stillness, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an5.24:4.9: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an5.24:4.10: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.24:5.1: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for right samādhi.
an5.24:5.2: When there is right samādhi, one who has fulfilled right samādhi has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an5.24:5.3: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an5.24:5.4: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.24:5.5: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
an5.24:5.6: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would all grow to fullness.
an5.24:5.7: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for right samādhi.
an5.24:5.8: When there is right samādhi, one who has fulfilled right samādhi has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an5.24:5.9: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an5.24:5.10: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
